page.title: 04ALBERT DOCK VILLAGE
page.content: The{Albert Dock,}once the site of the largest bonded warehouse in Europe, was closed in{1970}after being used for over a hundred years. It became derelict and the dock silted up. Many schemes for reopening it were discussed and eventually it was decided to reopen it as a{village {community and tourist attraction.}The mud was cleared from the dock so that some boats and small ships could come in. Part of the old warehouses have been converted into{shops, public {houses and restaurants.}Other warehouses are being converted into flats . At weekends various entertainers -{bands, singers, {jugglers}etc., perform for visitors. The Albert Dock Village is becoming a living community and a great tourist attraction.
